document.docAuthor: Palacio, Edgard, Bordera, Santiago, Sääksjärvi, Ilari E. & Díaz, Francisco
document.docTitle: Clistopyga kalima Palacio & Bordera & Sääksjärvi & Díaz 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Neotropical species of Clistopyga (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Pimplinae). Part II: the C. isayae species group, with the description of seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Clistopyga kalima
sp. nov.
can be distinguished from all other species of the
C. isayae
species group by the combination of the following characters: metapleuron entirely red ( Fig. 4D ); hind wing with abscissa of Cu 1 straight ( Fig. 4H ); occipital carina completely absent; subalar prominence sparsely punctuate, with about 13 setiferous punctures ( Fig. 11B ); clypeus 1.64 × as broad as medially long; malar space about as long as basal mandibular width ( Figs 4A, B ); setae of ovipositor sheath with a length on average about 1.85 × the sheath basal width.
Description. Female: Body length 8.4˗9.0 mm. Fore wing length 6.2–6.5 mm .

Mesosoma
(
Figs 4D, 4I
, 11B ). Pronotum shiny, mostly smooth, with fine and scattered setiferous punctures in upper posterior part. Mesoscutum entirely smooth and shiny, with fine and sparse setiferous punctures. Notauli moderately deep, reaching about 0.42 of length of mesoscutum (
Fig. 4I
). Mesopleuron shiny, with moderately sparse setiferous punctures, except in posterior part under speculum. Subalar prominence sparsely punctate, with about 13 setiferous punctures ( Fig. 11B ). Epicnemial carina weak, its dorsal end almost straight, ending at level of centre of pronotum. Metapleuron shiny, glabrous, except for some sparse setiferous punctures at posterior end, 2.7 × as long as deep. Propodeum smooth and shiny, with sparse and fine setiferous punctures laterally, in dorsal view 1.4 × as long as medially wide. Propodeal spiracle contiguous with groove separating propodeum and metapleuron, groove barely interrupted by spiracle ( Fig. 4D ). Hind leg with femur about 3.7–3.9 × as long as deep, about 0.90– 0.93 × as long as tibia.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
C. kalima
Palacio
sp. nov.
, holotype, ♀. A. Head, lateral view. B. Head, frontal view. C. Head, dorsal view. D. Mesosoma , lateral view. E. Metasoma, lateral view. F. Ovipositor. G. Fore wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a ) and vein Cu 1 b , respectively. H. Hind wing, upper and lower arrows indicates abscissa of Cu 1 (between M and cu-a ) and vein cu-a , respectively. I. Mesosoma , dorsal view. J. Metasoma, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Wings ( Figs 4G–H ). Fore wing with vein cu-a opposite Rs&M . Vein 2 rs-m about 0.40–0.50 × as long as abscissa of M between 2 rs-m and 2 m-cu . Abscissa of Cu 1 between 1 m-cu and Cu 1 a 1.40 × as long as Cu 1 b ( Fig. 4G ). Hind wing with vein cu-a about 0.30–0.45 × as long as abscissa of Cu 1 between M and cu-a ( Fig. 4H ). Vein cu-a reclivous, abscissa of Cu 1 vertical and straight. Vein Cu 1 weakly pigmented.
Etymology. This species is named in honour of the Precolombine indigenous tribe of Kalimas, who lived in the territory that today is the type locality, Valle del Cauca ( Colombia ).
